org.openmap4u.primitive

Interface LineStringBuildable<T extends LineStringBuildable<T>>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    PrimitiveBuildable<T>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ShapeBuildable<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    LineString, LineStringPrimitive, Shape, ShapePrimitive

    public interface LineStringBuildable<T extends LineStringBuildable<T>>
extends PrimitiveBuildable<T>

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T bezierTo(Point controlPoint1, Point controlPoint2, Point toPoint)
      Draws a bezier curve to the given point based on two control points.
      T lineTo(Point toPoint)
      Draws a straight line from the last path point to the provided point in map units.
      T moveTo(Point toPoint)
      Moves the path to the given point without drawing anything.
      T quadTo(Point controlPoint, Point toPoint)
      Draws a quadratic curve from the last drawn (red) -, with the help of a control (gray) -, to the end point (blue).
      T shape(java.awt.Shape shape)
      Sets the primitive shape (and overrides every already existing shapes).

    • Method Detail

      • bezierTo

        T bezierTo(Point controlPoint1,
           Point controlPoint2,
           Point toPoint)
        Draws a bezier curve to the given point based on two control points.
        Parameters:
        controlPoint1 - The first control point (red).
        controlPoint2 - The the second control point (blue).
        topoint - The point to draw to (blue).
        Example: Draws from the last point (red) via two controll points (red = from, blue = to), to the given point(blue).
        myBuilder.bezierTo(new Point(0.75, 1.375), new Point(1.0, .125), new Point(1.25, 0.75))= ... other example and another example
        Returns:
        The builder itself (fluent interface pattern).

      • lineTo

        T lineTo(Point toPoint)
        Draws a straight line from the last path point to the provided point in map units.
        Parameters:
        toPoint - The point where to draw to.
        Example: Draws from the last point (red) to the given point(blue).
        myBuilder.lineTo(new Point(1.0,1.1))=
        Returns:
        The builder itself (fluent interface pattern).

      • moveTo

        T moveTo(Point toPoint)
        Moves the path to the given point without drawing anything. It is used to move the "pencil" to the point, where you want to start-, or where you want to continue to draw.
        Parameters:
        toPoint - The point, where you start -, or where you continue to draw.
        Example:
        myBuilder.moveTo(new Point(1.0,1.1))= displays nothing (just moves the pen).

      • quadTo

        T quadTo(Point controlPoint,
         Point toPoint)
        Draws a quadratic curve from the last drawn (red) -, with the help of a control (gray) -, to the end point (blue).
        Parameters:
        controlPoint - The the control point (gray).
        toPoint - The end point (blue).
        Example: Draws from the last point (red) to the given point(blue) using te controll point (gray).
        myBuilder.quadTo(new point(.5,1.0),new Point(1.0,0.7))=
        Returns:
        The builder itself (fluent interface pattern).

      • shape

        T shape(java.awt.Shape shape)
        Sets the primitive shape (and overrides every already existing shapes).
        Parameters:
        shape - The awt shape geometry.

        Example:
        ... myBuilder.shape() =
        Returns:
        The Shape itself (method chaining pattern).
